The Desexing Of English
description: Sol Steinmetz is general editor of The World Book Dictionary. William Safire is on vacation.

title: TELEVISION WEEK
description: Diamond Dust Who was ''Cap'' Anson? ''The Game and Its Glory: Baseball's Hall of Fame'' has the answer. This hour-long special will be broadcast on NBC on Saturday at 10 P.M. Donald Sutherland, the Canadian-born actor who is an ardent Dodgers fan, will serve as host for the program, touring the Baseball Hall of Fame at Cooperstown and discussing, among other topics, how one gets in and who the first five inductees were.

title: SHOES? OF COURSE. BUT NOT IN HOUSE
description: IUNLOCK the door, put the screaming baby on the kitchen table and u ntie my shoes. They are off before I pull his hat from his head, u nzip my daughter's jacket, put down the groceries, let the dog out, o r check the mail. My feet do not hurt, and I am not worried about k eeping the already dirty carpet clean. I just do not wear shoes in t he house.

title: CANADA 'CRUSADE' AGAINST INFLATION HITS SNAG
description: With public confidence in him at one of its lowest points since he took power in 1968, Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau is having difficulty enlisting Canadians in his ''crusade'' to reduce the country's high inflation and end its recession.

title: Beaches
description: To the Editor: I'm sure the article ''On the Beach: A Roundup'' (Travel, June 23) will prompt many readers to submit their lists of favorite beaches. Here are mine: Surfside, Nantucket, Mass.; Sea Island, Ga.; Revolcadero, Mexico.

title: CABLE TV FOR CAPITAL COMES TO TURNING POINT
description: After 10 years of uncertainty, a decision on cable television for the 630,000 citizens of the District of Columbia is coming to a turning point, of sorts.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: THE ALEXANDRIA QUARTET. By Lawrence Durrell. (Pocket/Washington Square Press. 4 vols., $3.95 each.) To celebrate the 25th anniversary of the publication of the first novel in Lawrence Durrell's ''Alexandria Quartet,'' a monumental work that critics have compared in ambition and style to Joyce, Proust and Eliot, Washington Square Press is reissuing the four volumes in a uniform rack-size format. All deal with aspects of an exotic, decadent modern Alexandria. The four books tell essentially the same story but from different points of view and with different narrators, so the reader is continually surprised by new discoveries about people, motives and action. Each is named for its protagonist: ''Justine'' was published in 1957, ''Balthazar'' in 1958, ''Mountolive'' in 1958 and ''Clea'' in 1960.

title: A MOTHER WHO CARES WHAT HER CHILD READS
description: The issue of sexist and racist role models in children's literature may be of little concern to Mary Malone; if so, I must assume that sexism and racism themselves are minor matters to her.

description: A Federal judicial official in New York has urged swift action in filling two vacant judgeships in one of the busiest Federal courts in the nation.

title: THE DAY THE STRANGERS CAME
description: LIVING in New York had definitely left its mark. That fact hit home as soon as the strange van with the Wyoming plates pulled into our driveway.

title: HONG KONG'S STAKE IN AMERICA
description: HONG KONG A current Hong Kong business magazine shows a cartoon of a cashladen ''Texas or bust'' covered wagon carrying two unlikely looking pioneers, one wearing a suit and carrying an abacus. Atop a hill sits a pouting Ronald Reagan with an undersized bow and arrow and an oversized Indian headdress. ''What do you think, old boy,'' one Hong Kong businessman asks the other as they speed toward a Texas oil land purchase and a smiling gun-toting rancher, ''will the natives be friendly?''

title: NEW DRUG MAY CURB TROPIC 'RIVER BLINDNESS'
description: A single dose of a new drug appears to be effective in treating ''river blindness,'' a parasitic disease that is a major cause of blindness, scientists from the United States, Senegal and France have reported on the basis of a small study in West Africa. The new drug is called ivermectin.

He said the negotiations would involve the P.L.O., the Lebanese Government and Philip C. Habib, the United States special envoy, acting through Lebanese intermediaries. (Page 1, Column 6.)

title: 'THIS IS 2LZ-55983R-20'
description: Call One. ''Hello? Municipal Federal Trust?'' ''Yes.'' ''I'm having a problem with my mortgage --'' ''Your mortgage number?'' ''2LZ-55983R-20'' ''One moment please.'' ''Hello?'' ''Mortgage department?'' ''Yes. Your mortgage number?'' ''2LZ-55983R-20.'' ''One moment.'' Extended silence. ''Mr. Stone?'' ''Yes.'' ''What seems to be the problem?'' ''I've received a computerized note from the bank that my mortgage payment is late and that I now owe the bank, with late charges, $2,000.''

title: AT REAL ART WAYS: NEW WAYS IN JAZZ
description: FOR more than seven years, Real Art Ways, Hartford's ''artists' alternative space,'' has devoted itself to the presentation of new or experimental works of art, including avant-garde classical music, video forms, multimedia exhibitions and animated tapes. This week the subject is jazz, but predictably it's not the popular variety of jazz that brought the Woody Herman and Glenn Miller bands to New Haven for the big band festival this month.

title: Low Turnout of Voters Hinted by Gallup Poll
description: Three months before the Congressional elections, more than half the nation's eligible voters do not know the name of the Congressman representing their district, according to the the latest Gallup Poll.

title: ENVIRONEWS
description: NEW JERSEY has filed suit against James G. Watt, Secretary of the Interior, to prevent the sale of oil and natural-gas leases 86 miles and more off the coasts of Atlantic and Cape May Counties.

title: SOVIET UNION IRKED BY NORDIC VISITORS
description: A 40-year-old controversy over the executions of more than 4,000 Polish officers in the Katyn Forest was revived this week when some members of a visiting Nordic peace group boycotted an antinuclear meeting held at a Byelorussian village with a similar name.

title: CHEMICAL TREATMENT OF WOOD ROT CAN BE EFFECTIVE
description: WHEN regular painting and caulking are neglected around the outside of the house, or when other structural defects allow water to soak into wood trim and siding, all too often the rotting of some sections of the wood is the eventual outcome.

title: DEBATING N.J. YOUTH CRIME LAW
description: A century ago, common law still held that children older than seven were adults when it came to criminal intent. Then came the first juvenile court system, in Illinois in 1899, and with it the idea that young offenders merely lacked moral guidance, which the court would provide if parents could not.

title:
DINING OUT;
AN OUT-OF-THE-WAY PEEKSKILL SPOT
description: NOT easily accessible from the popular north-south super auto routes and, further, tucked well beyond a thickness of trees and shrubbery, Monteverde is a restaurant little-known in the county. Some might recall the building by the name Oldstone, one of the mansions built in the late 18th century by a Van Cortlandt. About 200 years of erosion and intermittent abandonment have blunted the grandeur of the place, as have successive renovations; however, through the cosmetics of the day some elegance, tattered though dignified, can still be seen.

The same might be said of those who as yet have no or few words, infants and very small children who respond to music instructions before they possess great verbal skills.

NEW JERSEY GUIDE;
NIGHTS OF NOSTALGIA

The tempo picks up a bit on Monday, when Buster Brown and Thelma Carpenter star in an evening of ''Tap and Song'' at Ellsworth Allen Community Park on Motor Avenue in Farmingdale.
