description: Decolonization Committee - 10:30 A.M. ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: PREMATURE LAMENTS FOR THE ART MARKET
description: To the Editor:

title: LEGISLATOR AND BUSINESSMAN LEAD IN MICHIGAN GUBERNATORIAL RACE
description: Representative James Blanchard appeared to have won the Democratic nomination for governor by a wide margin as early returns were counted, while in the Republican race, a conservative businessman, Richard Headlee, was the apparent upset winner in a tight three-way contest.

title: Briefs on the Arts; Movie Becoming a Play
description: Plays are adapted into movies regularly, but the reverse is rare. ''Inserts,'' a new play by John Byrum adapted from his 1975 film of the same name, opens Off Broadway Sept. 8 at the Actors and Directors Theater on Theater Row.

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: Manufacturers Push Exports
description: The United States manufacturing industry is increasingly dependent on exports for growth, the Conference Board said in a report yesterday.

title: Reagan Fills Guard Post
description: President Reagan has appointed Maj. Gen. Emmett H. Walker Jr. to be chief of the National Guard Bureau in the Pentagon, it was announced today.

title: BRAND INSULATIONS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Central Bancorp Offer for Union
description: Central Bancorp Inc. said that 59.7 percent of the Union Commerce Corporation's common stock outstanding had been tendered under its offer of $25 a share. The Cincinnati concern added that it was extending the offer for up to 61.3 percent of the stock to Sept. 10 from Aug. 13.

title: Real Estate; Downtown Building's Park Vista
description: time crowd in Hanover Park would have to eat their sandwiches in the shade.

title: CORADIAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $259,000 for the qr and $711,000 for the 6 mos

title: RALLY ATTEMPTS FAIL
description: After making two futile attempts at a rally, the stock market edged downward yesterday to another 27-month low. Fred S. Fraenkel of E.F. Hutton & Company said the market drop reflected anticipation among investors of disappointing corporate earnings for the third and fourth quarters.

title: Thomson Net Declines 2.8%
description: Thomson Newspapers Ltd., citing troubles at its flagship newspaper, The Globe and Mail of Toronto, today reported a 2.8 percent drop in second-quarter earnings.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Bank of Long Island, East Islip, N.Y., has appointed James J. Smith senior vice president.

title: THEATER: WORLD WAR I, 'JOHNNY GOT HIS GUN'
description: Dalton Trumbo's 1939 antiwar novel, ''Johnny Got His Gun,'' is a most unlikely candidate for dramatization. As Bradley Rand Smith affirms about his adaptation, a play for one actor, which opened last night at the Circle Repertory Company, everything takes place in ''the mind of Joe Bonham.'' All that remains of Bonham is his mind; he is a limbless, totally helpless veteran of World War I, kept alive more as an object than as a person. The only sense he retains is that of touch; he can feel a nurse's fingers tracing letters on his chest and he can respond by banging his head in Morse code.

title: APPLE FIGHTING COUNTERFEITS IN ORIENT
description: An Apple II home computer, with programs, was recently advertised in New York for $1,895. That was a reduction from $2,604. In Hong Kong, however, what looks like the same thing sells for as little as $300.

title: Slain Woman's Son Faces Mental Test
description: A Federal judge yesterday ordered a psychiatric examination for a 28-year-old Brooklyn man accused of murdering his mother by mailing her an explosive device.

title: FORUM GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Dexter to Shut Plant
description: The Dexter Lock Company, a 73-year-old door hardware manufacturer, is closing its Grand Rapids plant and consolidating the operation with an Auburn, Ala., facility, a plant official said today.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: ULYSSES AND DIZZY

title: Carnation Stores
description: The Carnation Company said its health and nutrition division would open 300 retail outlets offering weight-loss programs and nutritional advice, as well as health goods and vitamins. The company said it had retained Merrill Lynch & Company's Realty Commercial Services subsidiary to select sites and negotiate leases.

title: LUXEMBOURG STRICTURE ON ITALY BANKS
description: Italian banks with subsidiaries in Luxembourg agreed today to a demand by Luxembourg banking authorities that they unconditionally guarantee the solvency of their subsidiaries. In addition, the Italian banks agreed to dissolve holding companies controlling those subsidiaries to prevent potential evasion of financial responsibilities.

title: CONTROL LASER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Net income; yr-ago results have been restated to reflect the adoption of F.A.S.B. Statement No 52 regarding foreign currency translations

title: JUPITER INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
DENTAL WORLD CENTER INC reports earnings for Qtr to May 31
description: B-Net income; revs are net of fees to dentists

title: DOCTORS: NO RX's IN A-WAR
description: Physicians are as diverse in their political and social views as any other large group of citizens and rarely speak in unison on matter of public policy. But today they are virtually united in their effort to convey a simple, urgent message about nuclear war to the American public and the Administration.

title: FEDERAL OFFICIALS SAID TO SEEK REP. RICHMOND'S INDICTMENT
description: The Justice Department is in the process of seeking an indictment of Representative Frederick W. Richmond on tax charges, according to law-enforcement officials close to the investigation.

title: DEVELOPMENT CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Net income; revs for the latest 6 mos include a pretax gain of $2.8 million from the sale of operating property

title: DOME SELLS SOME OF ITS INTERESTS
description: Dome Petroleum Ltd. of Canada, burdened with about $8 billion (Canadian) in debt, yesterday announced the $270 million sale of its interests in several companies holding international exploration and production rights outside Canada, principally in Indonesia.

title: BOLAR PHARMACEUTICAL CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
MOSCOW DERIDES GLEN COVE CURB ON THE RUSSIANS
description: The Soviet newspaper Pravda today attributed restrictions on Soviet diplomats by Glen Cove, L.I., to the ''doubledyed anti-Sovietism'' of the Reagan Administration, which, it said, had inspired an anti-Soviet psychosis in the city.

title: JONES IS ROUTED AS METS LOSE
description: The St. Louis Cardinals knocked Randy Jones from the mound with a four-run first inning last night on their way to a 7-2 victory over the Mets at Shea Stadium.

title: 60-MINUTE GOURMET
description: IT is common these days to praise Italian food for its part in the education of the American palate concerning pasta. The public, with good reason, has come to admire many types of pasta other than spaghetti and lasagna and to enjoy hundreds of sauces for pasta that were unknown to the average cook less than a decade ago. The sauces may be made with fresh vegetables, fresh fish or seafood, tripe or brains, sweetbreads, chicken or veal. Another encouraging aspect is the widespread availability of homemade pasta.

title: Ford to Purchase Some of Its Shares
description: The Ford Motor Company said it would buy as many as 750,000 common shares in the open market at prevailing prices in the coming months.

title: BEGIN HINTS THAT MITTERRAND REMARK PAVED WAY FOR TERRORISTS' ATTACK
description: Prime Minister Menachem Begin suggested today that a statement last month by President Francois Mitterrand had helped create an atmosphere that encouraged terrorist attacks of the type that occurred Monday in a Jewish neighborhood in Paris.

title: Reynolds Takeover
description: SALEM, N.C., Aug. 10 (Reuters) - R.J. Reynolds Industries said its offer for 11,350,000 common shares of Heublein Inc. had been oversubscribed. Reynolds had offered $63 for each of 11,350,000 Heublein shares, or 52 percent of the shares outstanding. It said it had received about 17.8 million shares, or 82 percent of those outstanding, as of Monday night.

title: Taming the Blackboard Jungle
description: An obvious basic ingredient of effective education is an orderly atmosphere that allows teachers to teach and students to learn without having to worry about their physical safety. So New York City's success in cutting criminal offenses against teachers by 22 percent - the first decline of consequence in a decade - is heartening. So is the tale behind the turnabout.

title: Racketeering Trial Gets Autopsy Data
description: Evidence was presented in a Manhattan trial yesterday to show that the body of a murder victim found in Queens last year was Alphonse Indelicato, one of three missing leaders of the Bonanno ''crime family.''

title: Suffolk's Legislators Support A U.S.-Soviet Nuclear Freeze
description: The Suffolk County Legislature adopted a resolution today asking the United States to approve a ''bilateral and mutual'' nuclear arms freeze with the Soviet Union.

title: Chrysler Expands Search for Plant
description: The Chrysler Corporation said it had expanded its search for a second site to build diesel engines for 1985 and 1986 models, and Chrysler of Canada officials are worried that the auto maker's engine plant in Windsor, Ontario, will not be chosen.

title: TIGERS DEFEAT YANKS, 10-1
description: Doyle Alexander was ordered back to New York tonight to undergo a physical examination that will be concentrated on the hand the Yankee pitcher broke against a dugout wall in May. The order came during a 10-1 defeat to the Detroit Tigers in which Alexander was cuffed for six runs in three innings.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: An Ornate Restoration

title: Canada Oil Profits Drop
description: The profits of Canadian oil companies fell by $3 billion, or 34 percent, last year because of high interest rates, slack demand and the cost of the country's new nationalist energy policy, the Energy Department said today. The report said that foreign ownership dropped last year by 5 percent, to 67 percent.

title: Mazzilli Fans
description: Can a true blue-and-orange fan find happiness in the return of a former Met to New York, if it's in Yankee pinstripes? ''I'd rather have Lee Mazzilli play for Texas than for the Yankees,'' said Walter Chaluisant, a self-proclaimed Met fanatic from Ozone Park, Queens, who claims that being a Yankee-hater is a prerequisite for being a genuine Met fan. ''Maz is a born Met.''

title: Comings and Goings
description: The pro football debut of Renaldo Nehemiah, the hurdles recordholder, will probably be postponed. The San Francisco 49ers said the rookie wide receiver, recently recovered from a minor injury, might not be ready for the exhibition opener against the Raiders Saturday. ... The Peoria Prancers, a new farm team of the Rangers in the International Hockey League, hired as their first coach Glenn Patrick, who has some Ranger roots.

title: SEARS ROEBUCK ACCEPTANCE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ISRAELI JETS CONTINUE TO HIT PALESTINIAN AREAS OF BEIRUT
description: Israeli jets again attacked Palestinianheld areas on the fringe of the city today as the Palestinian guerrillas made preparations to leave Lebanon, apparently under the terms negotiated by the special United States envoy, Philip C. Habib.

title: Opposition Politicians Assail Marcos Speech
description: Filipino opposition politicians have reacted angrily to a speech by President Ferdinand E. Marcos in which he accused them and union leaders and ''subversives'' of plotting nationwide strikes, assassinations and bombings in September.

title: Blue Jays 4, Red Sox 0
description: TORONTO (UPI) - Dave Stieb pitched a two-hitter and Rance Mulliniks knocked in two runs with the first of his two doubles to help give the Toronto its fifth straight victory.

title: JAPANESE STANDS BY REVISIONS IN TEXTS THET IRRITATE CHINA
description: The Japanese Education Minister said today that he had no intention of correcting revisions to school history books that have caused a diplomatic dispute with China and South Korea.

title: DIGITAL EQUIPMENT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 31
NAVY SECRETARY FOR TRUMAN
description: John L. Sullivan, Secretary of the Navy in the Truman Administration, died Sunday night at Exeter Hospital in Exeter, N.H. He was 83 years old.

title: The Need to Cover Up
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: Enid Nemy's article of July 14 (''Hiding What a Swimsuit Reveals'') really hit home for me.

title: Krupp Unit Contract
description: Fried. Krupp said today that its Buckau-Walther subsidiary had won an order worth about $50.3 million from the Neyveli Lignite Corporation, of India, to build a coal-handling plant in Neyveli. The plant, to consist of two systems, each with a handling capacity of about 2,800 tons of coal an hour, will be installed at a power station.

title: FISCHER & PORTER CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Net income; yr-ago results have been restated to reflect F.A.S.B. Statement No 52

title: BRIEFS
description: * American Pacemaker Corp. said it had received and rejected a $1 million offer to settle a suit it filed in 1980 against Fairchild Camera and Instrument Co., charging that Fairchild delivered defective pacemaker parts.

title: Agronsky Given The Morse Award
description: Martin Agronsky, moderator of the public-television discussion program ''Agronsky and Company,'' has been named the recipient of the eighth annual Arthur D. Morse Fellowship in Communications and Society.

title: NEW VERSION GIVEN ON REAGAN STAND ON ARMS
description: Secretary of Defense Caspar W. Weinberger says that Congressional efforts to force President Reagan to hold down proposed military spending in the fiscal years 1984 and 1985 have been based on ''wishful thinking.''

title: DIONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
WEDNESDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Mets vs. St. Louis Cardinals, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing, Queens, 7:35 P.M. The Cardinals continue to battle for first place behind the rookie Willie McGee, who, heading into last night's game, was batting .424 against the Mets this season, with nine runs batted in. (Television -SportsChannel, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WMCA, 570; WGBB, 1240; 7:30 P.M.) Yankees vs.

title: ORGANIZED LABOR FACES AN UNCERTAIN ELECTION YEAR
description: With unemployment at the highest level since the start of World War II, with the rate of business failures at a 50-year high and with interest rates still choking commerce in many cities and most small towns, this should be the year, if history is a reliable guide, that organized labor reasserts itself as a major political force.

title: GALANOS ADDS CASUAL NOTES
description: THE models paraded silently down the long runway bisecting the large room at the Plaza Hotel. The clothes were tony, the mood subdued. It was James Galanos having the last word on fashions for fall and winter.

title: RETRENCHING AT DEL WEBB
description: Along a broad expanse of healthy, green lawn beside Del Webb Boulevard here, there are four churches hard by a golf course and a cemetery. It is a tidy, tranquil scene, befitting the nation's most populous retirement village.

title: SOHN OF JETS WILL START AGAINST PACKERS
description: Kurt Sohn, the free agent from Fordham who won a place with the Jets last year in spite of minimal credentials, will start at wide receiver in the first exhibition game, at Green Bay on Saturday night. And that helps to explain what exhibitions are all about.

title: Catering Service Still
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: In an article on lighter ice cream in The Living Section July 21, it was mentioned that the kosher catering business of Mintz's was closed. I would like to correct that statement by noting that although the retail business of Mintz Buffet has been closed, the catering service, Townhouse Catering, continues to be available, and information can be obtained by calling 685-5468. ETHEL MINTZ Manhattan

title: Western Union Operates Overseas
description: The Western Union Telegraph Company won Federal Communications Commission permission today to operate international telex and telegraph services for the first time in 39 years, and Thomas Mathai, a Western Union spokesman, said that the company initiated the worldwide service.

title: N.F.L. Motion For Stay Denied
description: The United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit, after a 90-minute hearing, ruled today against the National Football League in its fight to keep the Oakland Raiders from moving to Los Angeles.

title: CENVILL INVESTORS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-The company did not report yr-ago results saying they are not comparable since they include businesses which were disposed of prior to becoming eligible for real estate investment trust status

title: ALGOMA CENTRAL RAILWAY reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
MANVILLE'S HEAD TO RETIRE EARLY
description: When the troubled Manville Corporation of Denver announced layoffs and an early retirement program for salaried employees in May, it seemed a plan mainly to trim middle management.

title: ALL CITY INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Operating loss...C-Net loss

title: News Summary; WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 11, 1982
description: International Israel accepted most peace proposals on the siege of Beirut ''in principle,'' but continued to insist that most of the Palestinian fighters trapped there leave before the arrival of any members of an international peacekeeping force. The Israeli Cabinet also said it must receive in advance a ''full list'' of the Arab countries planning to accept the Palestinians and that the numbers leaving must be ''absolutely equivalent to the number of terrorists'' in Beirut, estimated at 6,000 to 9,000. (Page A1, Column 6.) Syria said it was willing to accept all the fighters that leaders of the Palestine Liberation Organization wanted to send to Damascus. The reversal of policy came as several other Arab countries were reported to have agreed to accept Palestinians. (A1:4.)

title: 1 WOUNDED IN PARIS BY BLAST AT A BANK ONCE JEWISH-OWNED
description: A bomb exploded early today outside a bank that had been Jewish owned, severely wounding a woman who was walking her dog.

title: Japanese Salt Cookery
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: I enjoyed your article on cooking in salt (''Getting the Most Out of Meat by Cooking in Salt Bed or Pastry'') July 7. You omitted to mention, although I am sure you know about, the Japanese salt broiling called shioyaki.

title: ABOUT NEW YORK
description: John Chase Wood 3d, resplendent in aqua terry-cloth rompers, wheeled himself around the living room in his walker, laughing. John is one of those satisfying Gerber babies, moon-faced, pleasantly pudgy, with blond fuzz and blue eyes, and even now, at 5 months, when he is cutting a tooth, he is happy most of the time. He lives with his mother, Diana, in a little house in New Jersey, in one of those places across the Hudson where the trees are older than the people and everything seems safe.

title: 3 CAPTIVES TELL OF THEIR LIVES WITH THE P.L.O.
description: The following dispatch has been altered by Israeli military censorship.

title: LACLEDE GAS CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Federal Express
description: The Federal Express Corporation said it plans to sell its fleet of 32 Dassault Falcon 20 cargo aircraft. It said it would phase out the older planes in favor of Boeing 727-100's and 727-200's and McDonnell Douglas DC-10's.

title: News Analysis
description: Just when it looked like the Metropolitan Transportation Authority had all that it could handle - or maybe even more than it could handle - it announced that it would soon be taking over the three commuter rail lines that link New York City and its northern suburbs.

title: Dome Share Purchase
description: A total of 4,114,190 Dome Resources Ltd. Class A preferred shares were tendered on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges before 5 P.M. Monday, the Toronto Stock Exchange said today, in response to a $50-a-share (Canadian) offer from Dome Petroleum Ltd. for 10 million of the $5.75 shares. Full subscription would have given Dome Petroleum about 32.5 percent of the preferred outstanding.

title: SARATOGA'S BURGEONING RESTAURANT SCENE
description: racing set has taken over this town, bringing with it enormous appetites for food and other pleasures and perhaps as much as $100 million to underwrite the nonstop monthlong party that runs though August and centers on the old Victorian clubhouse of the Saratoga Race Course.

title: GOVERNOR RACE SWITCHES TO TV FOR DEMOCRATS
description: Eyes twinkling, Mario M. Cuomo's image looked out from television sets yesterday on which an announcer had just noted that Mayor Koch once said Mr. Cuomo would be a ''great'' governor.

title: HOUSE VOTES BILL CREATING NEW MILK PRICE SUPPORTS
description: Despite objections from the Reagan Administration, the House today approved farm legislation to create a new program of milk price supports and to pay grain farmers to leave some of their acres fallow next year.

title: SPENDING FOR CARIBBEAN AREA BACKED
description: The Reagan Administration won a preliminary victory late this evening when the Senate refused to strike economic and military aid for the Caribbean from a $9 billion supplemental appropriation bill.

title: FOOD NOTES
description: Sturgeon-Caviar Mousse

title: REAGAN HOPEFUL ON LEBANON AND A MOMENTUM FOR PEACE
description: President Reagan voiced optimism today that Palestinian guerrillas would shortly withdraw from Beirut and told an Israeli opposition leader that there was ''momentum'' for further peace talks in the Middle East once the crisis in Lebanon ended.

title: TAX PANEL SPLIT OVER SPENDING
description: House and Senate conferees on the $98.9 billion tax bill said tonight that they were deadlocked over proposals to cut welfare spending.

title: CBS/A.T.&T. Videotex
description: CBS Inc. and the American Telephone and Telegraph Company said yesterday that they would begin a field test this fall in New Jersey of their jointly operated CBS/A.T.&T. Videotex operation using information from The New York Times and The Newark Star-Ledger. CBS said it would be responsible for assembly of the information to be used, while A.T.&T. would provide computer equipment, including home terminals. Videotex is a two-way service that allows subscribers to get information and perform other functions using their home terminals or specially equipped television sets connected to telephone lines.

title: RANCHERS EXPLORATION & DEVELOPMENT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 3
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $3,599,269 for the qr and $3,600,000 for the yr...C-Net income

title: Transactions; BASEBALL
description: HOUSTON (NL) - Dismissed Bill Virdon as manager and replaced him with Bob Lillis, a coach, on an interim basis.

title: MURDERER IS EXECUTED IN VIRGINIA AFTER JUSTICE OVERRULES LAST STAY
description: Frank J. Coppola, convicted in 1978 of beating a Newport News woman to death, was executed in the electric chair here tonight after Chief Justice Warren E. Burger overruled a stay granted earlier today by a Federal appeals court judge.

title: BAR GROUP SPLIT ON TAX SHELTER CASE
description: The American Bar Association has angered many leading tax lawyers who are active members by refusing to oppose what they call an ''outrageous'' tax shelter concept, now before the Supreme Court, that could allow the wealthy to escape taxes on millions of dollars in income.

title: CONNORS ADVANCES, AS DOES McENROE
description: Jimmy Connors overcame a stubborn but mistake-prone challenge from Pat Cash, an 18-year-old Australian, in the Canadian Open tonight and won, 7-5, 6-4, in a match between the senior and junior Wimbledon champions.

title: VOTE FOR ARMS TALKS
description: The American Bar Association's House of Delegates today passed a resolution calling for ''serious negotiations to end the nuclear arms race'' and an end to ''conduct and rhetoric that invite nuclear confrontation.''

title: ASTRO DRILLING CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CULINARY INSTITUTE'S RESTAURANT
description: A ribbon made of pretzels was cut with a chef's knife last week in Hyde Park, N.Y., to open the Culinary Institute of America's new restuarant, American Bounty, which will be serving American cuisine.

title: Trenton's New Start on Auto Insurance
description: New Jersey's Republican Governor Kean and Assemblyman Michael Adubato, a Democrat, are joining forces to reform the state's troubled auto insurance system. The need is urgent, and their approach is sound.

title: EQUITABLE SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
DEFUND THE LEFT
description: Is it fair to require taxpayers to finance the political activities of groups whose views they do not share? Most people would say no. Yet it has been estimated that, since the 1970's, hundreds of millions of dollars - maybe more than $1 billion - in taxpayers' money has been used each year to support and spread political views that the American people have consistently and overwhelmingly rejected.

title: Interest Rates Are Steady; Uncertainty Called Factor
description: Interest rates were little changed in trading yesterday, reflecting the uncertainty of credit market participants about the future course of the rates.

title: TRANSWAY INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
145 Were Killed In Kenyan Uprising
description: The death toll in the unsuccessful military coup in Kenya on Aug. 1 was 145, a leading member of the governing party said today.

title: GOVERNORS NARROWLY REJECT BUDGET-BALANCING PROPOSAL
description: The nation's governors refused today, by a single vote, to support a constitutional amendment requiring the Federal budget to be balanced.

title: HENDERSON PETROLEUM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Net loss; yr-ago results reflect the acquisition of Crest Resources Inc

title: SHELTERS FOR MENTAL PATIENTS SOUGHT IN SUIT AGAINST STATE
description: Nearly 140 mental patients who are ready for release from the Manhattan State Psychiatric Center have been confined there for months against their will because the hospital has no place to send them, according to a class-action suit begun yesterday against the state by a court-affiliated legal aid group.

title: LINCOLN INCOME LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Operating earnings...C-Net income

title: Economic Scene; Future Policy And Feldstein
description: WHAT does President Reagan's choice of Martin S. Feldstein of Harvard to be chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers mean for the future of the Administration's economic policy?

title: A Plea for Asylum
description: Hu Na, the Chinese women's tennis star, defected to this country for personal reasons and has no plans of joining the professional circuit, said her attorney, Edward C.Y. Lau of San Francisco, in arguing that her request for asylum be granted. ''She's aware she has no professional experience,'' said Mr. Lau.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: The Hazards Of Judicial Conferences

title: SIMON, NORTON, INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including extraordinary gains of $23,215,000 for the qr and $28,650,000 for the yr and a loss of $6,602,000 for the qr and a gain of $12,968,000 for the yr from discontinued operations...C-Including income from discontinued operations of$3,057,000 for the qr and $4,532,000 for the yr

title: Philip Johnson In Times Sq. Plan
description: Philip Johnson yesterday was named the master planner of a fourtower office group at the southern end of the Times Square area.

title: ASTROS DISMISS VIRDON
description: Bill Virdon, who brought the Houston Astros from last place in 1975 to a divisional championship in 1980, was dismissed as manager today with the club in fifth place.

title: McDonnell Douglas
description: The McDonnell Douglas Corporation said today that ALM Antillean Airways had purchased two of its super 80 jetliners, to be equipped with the United Technologies Corporation's Pratt & Whitney JT8D-217A engines. The planes will replace two DC-9 series 30 jetliners now operated by the Netherlands Antilles airline.

title: FORD SHUTS DOWN 4 SOUTH AFRICA PLANTS
description: The Ford Motor Company's South African subsidiary in Port Elizabeth closed all four of its factories today because of a series of strikes by black workers.

title: BRIEFS ON THE ARTS
description: Hispanicism in Literature

title: 2 Sentenced to Death In Korean Arson Case
description: Two men were sentenced to death and two women to life imprisonment today for setting fire to a United States cultural center here last March, killing a Korean student.

title: NAPCO INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
IMMIGRATION BILL HAS PERSONAL ROOTS
description: Back in World War II, when he was a teen-ager in Cody, Wyo., Alan K. Simpson would visit a Japanese-American internment camp and play with children his age who were living behind barbed wire.

title: 55 Hurt in Canada Rail Crash
description: A passenger train and freight train collided head on near here today, derailing several cars and injuring 55 people, according to a hospital spokesman. The police said the passenger train, traveling from London to Toronto, had been carrying about 110 people.

title: 2 Homes in West Bank Demolished in Reprisal
description: Israeli soldiers demolished two Arab houses in the occupied West Bank on Monday in retaliation for a firebomb attack on an Israeli bus, an army spokesman said today.

title: REQUIRED READING
description: 'No Way ... '

title: Folk Dancers to Appear At Drew U. on Monday
description: The New Jersey Shakespeare Festival at Drew University in Madison, N.J., will present the Vanaver Caravan, a folk-dance troupe, next Monday at 8 P.M. The dance company performs a series of songs, dances, music and games inspired by folk traditions throughout the world. Dances of Appalachia, North American step dances, English clog and traditional Irish dances, as well as numerous works drawn from the Balkans, Greece, Israel and the Caucasus, will be performed to the accompaniment of a troupe of musicians playing instruments such as the Ullian Pipes, mountain dulcimer, five-string banjo, autoharp, water drum and washboard.

title: 25% STAKE SOUGHT IN WOMEN'S BANK
description: Ralph Vallone Jr., a former director of the First Women's Bank in New York, said yesterday that he wanted to increase his stake in the bank to more than 25 percent, but the bank's top executive indicated that the investment would not be welcome.

title: TAYLOR RENTAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Net income; shr earnings figures reflect a 5-for-4 stock split affected by means of a 25 percent stock divd in May 1981

title: JERSEY INCOME TAX INCREASE PROPOSED
description: Assembly Speaker Alan J. Karcher, Democrat of Sayreville, said today that he would introduce a bill next month that would increase the state income tax for persons earning more than $40,000.

title: Careers; The Need For Water Managers
description: THE ponds, fountains and reflecting pools that are an increasingly prominent part of the urban landscape may be one pleasant precursor of what could be a major problem in the late 1980's - water.

title: Sale of Braniff Jets
description: Citicorp said its Citicorp Industrial Credit subsidiary and USAir Inc. had agreed to market seven Boeing 727-200 airlines that had been operated by the Braniff International Corporation. Eight major American banks became coowners of the craft through a trust set up in the reorganization of Braniff's realty subsidiary in exchange for the cancellation of debt.

title: MARINES GET READY FOR DUTY IN BEIRUT
description: With the prospect that Palestinian guerrillas may leave Beirut soon, the Defense Department has begun preparing to send a peacekeeping force of 1,000 Marines into the city about 10 days after the Palestinians begin to depart, officials said today.

title: THE BREAKFAST, LUNCH AND DINNER OF CHAMPIONS
description: MARK GASTINEAU, a defensive end for the New York Jets football team, may fight off a 250-pound tackle and toss a 200-pound halfback aside to get to an opposing quarterback, but after the game he delicately removes the roll from his hamburger.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Bucking the Mainstream

title: CBS CABLE'S PROSPECTS CLOUDY DESPITE ACCLAIM
description: CBS Cable, widely regarded as the most acclaimed service available to cable-television subscribers, is facing an uncertain future amid persistent reports that it will be shut down or sold by the end of the year.

title: MTS SYSTEMS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Financing Plan For Rail Route
description: The Interstate Commerce Commission said it had approved a plan enabling the Chicago & North Western Transportation Company to finance construction of a rail route to Wyoming's Powder River Basin coal fields.

title: AMERICANS ARE DISCOVERING THE PUNGENT PERSONALITY OF SORREL
description: IN the all-too-brief life span of fresh herbs in the Northeast, mid-August marks the beginning of the end for many. But there are some robust perennials whose longevity we can look forward to celebrating until the last splash of Indian summer in October. One of them is sorrel.

title: P.L.O. FOES LINKED TO ATTACK IN PARIS
description: France said today that it had evidence suggesting that Monday's terrorist attack in a Jewish neighborhood here might have involved the same Palestinian renegade group that has been linked to attacks on an Israeli diplomat in London and a synagogue in Vienna.

title: A Cloak of Victory
description: His team had lost 12 of 15 games, his job was in jeopardy and he had even received a telephone death threat when Manager Tony LaRussa of the White Sox wrapped himself in his warm-up jacket on a muggy, 80-degree night in Chicago. But starting that night, the White Sox went on a five-game winning streak and they have won nine of 11 games with LaRussa wearing the jacket.

title: A DRAGON AND GERSHWIN OPEN OUTDOOR FESTIVAL
description: Rippling its pink and purple wings, a bright green and blue dragon snaked its 25-foot length around Damrosch Park, stepping high to the beat of a Dixieland band playing ''When the Saints Go Marching in.''

title: LTV Sells Division
description: The LTV Corporation said it had completed the sale of its Kentron International division to a group of investors. Philip R. Cowen, formerly vice president, finance, of LTV's Vought unit, was named chairman and chief executive officer of Kentron. Mr. Cowen and Bass Brothers Enterprises Inc., along with other Kentron managers, are principal owners of the new company. Kentron has annual sales exceeding $100 million, LTV said.

title: RECOGNITION ELUDES TERRELL
description: Despite his conspicuous size, there is nothing menacing about Ernie Terrell, once the World Boxing Association's heavyweight champion and currently the promoter of undistinguished fights.

title: BITCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Judge Aids Police In Seizing Suspect
description: A Family Court judge and his son cornered a robbery suspect who had escaped yesterday with two others on foot after a high-speed chase with the police, authorities said.

title: MCDOWELL ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
No Headline
description: DODGERS WIN, PASS STUMBLING BRAVES

title: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 11, 1982; International
description: A House panel approved the repeal of U.S. sanctions against the sale of equipment for a Soviet natural gas pipeline to Western Europe. The action, a rebuff to the Reagan Administration, reflected concern that the sanctions were costing jobs and straining relations with European allies. Seven Republicans voted for the bill despite an appeal from Secretary of State George P. Shultz. (Page A1.)

title: Hospital Strike Cuts Services in Britain
description: More than half of Britain's 2,500 Government-run hospitals offered only emergency services today as hundreds of thousands of British hospital workers struck or took part in slowdowns and demonstrations, British health officials said.

title: COMPACT VIDEO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Apr 30
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $213,000 for the qr and $1.1 million for the yr and a loss of $5.1 million for the yr on the disposal of discontinued operations...C-Net income including ains from discontinued operations of $220,000 for the qr and $555,000 for the yr

title: RUINING EXTRADITION
description: For more than two centuries, the United States has provided a refuge to which opponents of authoritarian regimes could flee without fear that they would be returned to stand trial for political offenses. That policy may be about to end.

title: ONCE AGAIN, GIANTS WILL RELY ON SHIRK
description: Gary Shirk is starting his ninth season in pro football, and he has heard all the putdowns before. As a tight end, say the critics, he is too small, too slow and too old.

title: STATEMENT MADE BY ISRAELIS
description: Following is the text of a statement made by the Israeli Cabinet today after considering the Lebanon peace plan submitted by the United States:

title: EUROPEANS FACE STEEL PENALTIES
description: In a new set of rulings expected to aggravate trade tensions with Europe, the Commerce Department said today that five Common Market countries and Rumania illegally dumped steel in the United States by selling it at prices as much as 41 percent below ''fair value.''

title: PETROLEUM EQUIPMENT TOOLS CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
HANNAFORD BROS CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CANADA CEMENT LAFARGE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
CLOROX CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
SYRIA OFFERS P.L.O. A REFUGE
description: Israel accepted a United States peace plan for Beirut ''in principle'' today, but it continued to insist that the majority of the Palestinian guerrillas trapped there leave before the entry of any part of a multinational peacekeeping force.

title: Q&A
description: Q. At times when I cut open a freshly purchased grapefruit, I find that one or more of the seeds have sprouted inside. It seems to give it a distinctly unpleasant taste. Can you tell me why this happens and how to avoid buying such grapefruits?

title: UNWARRANTED WORRIES ABOUT WEST GERMANY
description: To the Editor:

title: Nedbank Branch Here
description: Nedbank Ltd. said today it would establish a full banking branch in New York, making it the first South African bank to operate a full branch in that city. Nedbank has had a representative office in New York since 1958.

title: 2 TO APPEAL IN POLICE SHOOTING
description: Attorneys for Anthony N. LaBorde and James D. York said yesterday that they would appeal the guilty verdict against their clients on charges of attempted murder in the second degree.

title: HAZARDOUS WASTES: A STEP IN THE RIGHT DIRECTION
description: To the Editor:

title: MUSIC: HORN AND PIANO
description: WHILE the ventilators inside Avery Fisher Hall cooled and dried Monday's swampy outdoor air, the evening's music seemed to be airconditioning our spirits as well. This latest edition of the Mostly Mozart Festival was Mozart and Haydn, and in these two symphonies and two concertos there was little either to trouble the soul or to agitate the sweat glands.

title: TOKYO EDGED BY NEW YORK TEAM
description: For two weeks, a team of 11-and 12-year-old boys of summer from New York City and Tokyo has played a series of 10 games against teams of Japanese youngsters. The baseball exchange is part of the sister-city relationship between New York and Tokyo.

title: Mother Teresa on Way To See Order in Beirut
description: Mother Teresa, winner of the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979, flew to Cyprus today en route to visit six members of her order in east Beirut, a spokeswoman for the order said.

title: KANSAS CITY LIFE INSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ALEXANDER ENERGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Quotation of the Day
description: ''An elderly woman says in an angry voice: 'Those spying machinations of the Soviet diplomats interfere with my TV watching.'

title: Wiggins Charge Held In Abeyance
description: Al Wiggins, the San Diego Padres' rookie outfielder, was granted permission today to enter a drug diversion program rather than face a charge of cocaine possession.

title: SANDWICHES: MAKING THE MOST OF A GOOD THING
description: DESPITE the enduring popularity of the sandwich, it is suffering from an image problem. ''Only'' and ''just'' are the words we use to trivialize sandwich meals, whether to indicate that we are not very hungry or have not eaten much, or when we do not want a host or hostess to embark on more elaborate preparations. ''Just a sandwich will be fine,'' we say generously. ''I only had a sandwich for lunch,'' a man might tell his wife, indicating that he has eaten lightly and so deserves an especially good dinner.

title: TEXAN IS BELIEVED TO TO HAVE SLAIN 22
description: A 28-year-old bus mechanic who came to Houston 16 months ago from Michigan is believed by the police here to have murdered nine young women in Houston and 13 others in Michigan, Ontario and other parts of Texas.

title: ILLINOIS PROBATION LIFTED BY BIG TEN
description: The University of Illinois football team, the arena in what had been a fierce fight between the school and the Big Ten Conference over the eligibility of the quarterback Dave Wilson, has been taken off probation, the league's faculty representatives said today.

title: Earnings Decline 6.7% At Leading Advertisers
description: The nation's 125 leading advertisers reported a 6.7 percent decline in earnings, to $21.8 billion, and a 1.6 percent decline in sales, to $511.8 billion, during the first six months of 1982, according to The Gallagher Report.

title: States Court Harvester
description: The state governments of Indiana and Ohio are dangling multimillion-dollar financing packages before the International Harvester Company in a duel over which state will lose a truck-assembly plant operated by Harvester.

title: Jordan Tells of Inability To Identify Assailant
description: Vernon E. Jordan Jr., the civil rights leader, testified today that he did not see who pulled the trigger or hear the gunshot that struck him as he stepped from a car in front of a Fort Wayne motel two years ago.

title: Briefs on the Arts; Public Stations Win Right to Editorialize
description: The right of public television and radio stations to editorialize was won yesterday in United States District Court in Los Angeles. Judge Malcolm Lucas, in a 21-page decision, ruled that public stations had the same right to express their opinions on the air as commercial stations have had all along under the First Amendment.

title: Bridge: Charles Martel Beats Foes In Modern Battles of Tours
description: English schoolchildren learning about European history are sometimes taught this jingle about Charlemagne's grandfather who stemmed a tide of invasion: ''Charles Martel did pretty well; he defeated the Moors at the Battle of Tours in 732.''

title: WARRIOR IN A WHEELCHAIR DEFIES BOLIVIA'S MILITARY
description: As he lay shot in the back, Genaro Flores Santos remembers, the soldiers above him argued over who would get credit for gunning him down and collect the Government reward.

title: PARIS, BREAKING RANKS, ENDS ARGENTINA ARMS BAN
description: France announced the end of its embargo on arms sales to Argentina today, opening the way for the delivery of jet fighters armed with the type of missile that sank two British ships during the war over the Falkland Islands.

title: COMBINED INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to July 3
5 Persons Found Slain In 2 Fort Worth Houses
description: Police officers investigating the decapitation of a 20-year-old man at his home found four more bodies next door today while looking for witnesses to the first death, the authorities said.

title: DR. DAVID P. OSBORNE JR.
description: Dr. David P. Osborne Jr., assistant professor of neurology at the New York University School of Medicine, was killed Friday in an automobile accident in Santa Fe, N.M. He was 38 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: 8 Enter Guilty Pleas In Kickback Scheme
description: The president of two companies and seven salesmen for the companies have pleaded guilty to Federal charges that they participated in a nationwide kickback scheme to sell chemical and cleaning products to city and county governments.

title: SPECIALIST DOUBTFUL THAT HINCKLEY CAN EVER GAIN HOSPTIAL RELEASE
description: John W. Hinckley Jr. is now under a court-ordered confinement in St. Elizabeths Hospital on the outskirts of Washington, D.C., that may well last for the rest of his life. On Monday a Federal district judge ordered the Presidential assailant committed to a mental institution for an indefinite period, after a jury, on June 21, found Mr. Hinckley not guilty by reason of insanity of shooting President Reagan and three other men.

title: Changing Times
description: Sandra Haynie is testimony to the growth of prize money on the Ladies Professional Golf Association in two decades.

title: REAGAN'S EFFORTS SLOW OPPOSITION TO TAX RISE
description: President Reagan's personal lobbying campaign has slowed the rebellion of conservative lawmakers against the $98.9 billion tax increase now being drafted on Capitol Hill, according to Congressional analysts from both parties. But the bill could still have a tough time passing this year.

title: U.S. Suspects Afghans Of Chemical Warfare
description: The United States told the 40-nation Disarmament Committee today that evidence was mounting that Sovietbacked soldiers were using chemical weapons against anti-Government forces in Afghanistan.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: By Christopher Lehmann-Haupt DIFFERENT SEASONS. By Stephen King. 527 pages. Viking. $16.95.

title: 'THE FAMILY'
description: THE Manpyo family mansion, an unusual place for Japan, has flowered wallpaper, brocade sofas, abundant Greek statuary, stainedglass Moorish windows, plenty of crystal chandeliers (there are several in the living room alone) and three brass beds in the master bedroom.

title: GEORGIANS VOTE FOR TOP STATE OFFICES
description: United States Representative Bo Ginn led a field of 10 Democrats, including a former member of the Carter Administration, in results from Georgia's gubernatorial primary.

title: BAR GROUP PUTS OFF CONSIDERATION OF ETHICS CODE
description: The American Bar Association voted today to postpone, until February, the asssocition's consideration of a complex and controversial new model code of legal ethics.

title: HOUSE UNIT APPROVES TRADE BENEFITS FOR RUMANIA
description: The House moved closer today toward its annual renewal of normal trade relations with Rumania despite concern that the Bucharest Government has been violating the human rights of its citizens.

title: Gertrude Bacon Dead; Ex-Family Court Judge
description: Gertrude M. Bacon, a former Family Court judge and the founder of Parents Anonymous, died at her home in Manhattan on Monday after a long illness. She was 65 years old.

title: CRIME CONTROL INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
A Second Opinion
description: The preliminary report of the second opinion on the injury to the left shoulder of Bobby Czyz, the undefeated middleweight boxer from Wanaque, N.J., is optimistic. Czyz, whose 20 pro fights have all been on national television, was scheduled to fight next Sunday, but he suffered the injury, at first thought to be a torn rotator cuff, in training.

title: OBSTACLES OF SUMMER CAMP
description: Outside, the temperature was 85 degrees, and most of Long Island seemed to be either indoors or at the beach. Ken Schroy and Marty Lyons, summer-camp roommates, were about to be neither.

title: Record Campaign Donations
description: Fund raising and spending by political action committees are setting records this year, with more than $100 million in contributions from the groups already donated to election campaigns. The Federal Election Commission reported Monday that more than 2,000 political committees raised $138.7 million and spent $105.7 million from Jan. 1, 1981, through June 30 of this year.

title: WINE TALK
description: WHAT is the proper age for drinking a cabernet sauvignon from California, the ideal time to catch the wine at its peak, the moment when it has developed the soft and velvety richness of maturity? The answer depends on the producer, but Louis P. Martini probably knows better than most. He has one of the few cellars with many old vintages, for the Louis Martini Winery in St. Helena, Calif., was making cabernets long before most of the Napa Valley's other wineries were built.

title: GOLDEN WEST FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $5,573,484 for the qr and $10,980,000 for the 6 mos...C-Net income

title: MCDERMOTT INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ATI INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 26
description: B-Including extraordinary credits of $294,375 for the qr and $421,437 for the 9mos...C-Net loss

title: Knee Is Better, Nilsson Reports
description: For the first time in 11 months, Ulf Nilsson is optimistic about playing hockey for the Rangers again. After surgery last Sept. 9 to repair a dislocated right kneecap, Nilsson missed the entire 1981-82 season.

title: T-BAR INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Shr earnings have been adjusted for a 3-for-2 stock split paid in June 1982

title: KELLY SERVICES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: Shr earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split in Feb 1982

title: HOUSE AUTHORIZES RADIO STATION TO SEND U.S. 'MESSAGE' TO CUBA
description: The House voted 250 to 134 tonight to authorize a new United States radio station for broadcasts to Cuba. The vote sending the bill to the Senate came after more than six hours of floor debate over the $7.5 million measure to establish Radio Marti, which has been a priority item on the Reagan Administration's foreign policy agenda.

title: REAGAN'S AIDES TOLD TO WITHHOLD CAMPAIGN AID TO FOES OF TAX RISE
description: Instructions went out from the White House today to apply maximum pressure on Republican members of Congress to support President Reagan's legislation to increase taxes.

title: Less Costly Tubes; TO THE LIVING SECTION:
description: While the cost of tomato paste in tubes would certainly be higher than in cans (''When Flavor Comes in Tubes,'' July 21), the difference in price seems exorbitant.

title: CONGRESS BALKING AT REAGAN PLAN FOR DISABLED
description: The Reagan Administration's proposals to curtail Federal overseeing of public education for handicapped children encountered strong bipartisan opposition today in both the Senate and the House.

title: Telefunken Receiver Set
description: A spokesman for the Frankfurt court handling the AEG-Telefunken reorganization said today that Wilhelm Andreas Schaaf, a Frankfurt lawyer, had been named receiver and will work jointly with the existing management board in running the company's affairs.

title: DIGITAL EQUIPMENT CLIMBS 4.1%
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation reported yesterday that net income in the fourth fiscal quarter of 1982 rose 4.1 percent, while revenues increased 15.1 percent.

title: U.S.-Ford Accord Upheld by Appeals Panel
description: A Federal appeals court panel today upheld a settlement between the Government and the Ford Motor Company that prevented the recall of millions of vehicles with automatic transmissions suspected of slipping from park into reverse.

title: No Bid By Allied
description: The Allied Corporation eliminated itself yesterday as a potential suitor for the Cities Service, announcing that after an analysis of the oil concern it had decided against a purchase.

title: Caution Sign
description: The two-time former world driving champion, Niki Lauda of Austria, angered by what he thinks are an increasing number of driver errors on the Grand Prix circuit, said he planned to ''call to order'' his fellow Formula One drivers before next weekend's Austrian Grand Prix. ''I'm going to tell them, 'It can't continue like this - correct your attitude or we'll all kill one another,' '' said Lauda, who tore ligaments in his right hand while qualifying for the German Grand Prix last week.

title: IMPORTANCE OF GESTURE IN MUSICAL EXPERIENCE
description: EVER since people have been making music, other people have insisted on talking about it. For every composer, there has been a critic; for every musical action an equal, if not apposite, verbal reaction, for every construction in tone, a corresponding effort using mere words.

title: Inquiry on Marilyn Monroe
description: The County Board of Supervisors voted, today, 5 to 0, to ask the District Attorney to reopen the investigation into the death of Marilyn Monroe, whose death 20 years ago was ruled a suicide by drug overdose.

title: New Walton Test
description: Bill Walton, the San Diego Clippers' injured center who has expressed hopes of returning to the National Basketball Association, is scheduled to play in a Summer Pro League game at Loyola Marymount University Wednesday night, a spokesman for the league said today.

title: Cadwell Davis Savage To Drop a Name
description: As Neve Savage departs to become a management director at Compton Advertising, his name will be dropped from Cadwell Davis Savage/Advertising, which becomes Cadwell Davis Partners. Franchellie Cadwell remains president and Herman Davis executive vice president and creative director. Mr. Savage will be working largely on Procter & Gamble business, of which there is none more important at Compton.

title: COMPACT DOUBLE BOILER
description: ANYONE whose cooking repertory includes egg- and cream-based sauces or desserts knows the value of a double boiler. Sauces made with egg yolks in particular, such as hollandaise and sabayon, require a constant, moderate level of heat to reach the proper consistency. This is most easily accomplished with some form of double boiler.

title: Greyhound Cuts
description: John W. Teets, chief executive of the Greyhound Corporation, said the company had eliminated 104 jobs and transferred 89 workers to Greyhound-Armour subsidiaries, completing a plan to cut the headquarters staff 28 percent and to save $3.8 million.

title: VERSATILE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-After an extraordinary charge of $280,000 for the qr and including a tax credit of $238,000 for the 6 mos...C-Including tax credits of $1,016,000 for the qr and $1,898,000 for the 6 mos

title: DELAY IN ARAB TALKS IS SOUGHT
description: Lebanon has asked the Arab League to postpone indefinitely a meeting of heads of state planned for Fez, Morocco, League sources said today.

title: THE INSOMNIAC'S PALINDROME 12:21 JAY H. HEYMAN
description: IT is to Michael Winship that New Yorkers should express their gratitude for the discovery of a new art form. ''The form is Dadaist in structure,'' says Mr. Winship, a television producer who lives in Manhattan, ''and it can be engaged in by anyone possessing an electric typewriter with one of those plastic correction ribbons.''

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Surgery for Gotbaum

title: Searle-Ajinomoto Venture in Europe
description: The G.D. Searle & Company said it would market the artificial sweetener Nutrasweet, its brand name for Aspartame, in Eastern and Western Europe, through a venture with Ajinomoto of Japan.

title: BRIEFING
description: Threat From Helms

title: CURBS ON PIPELINE SET BACK IN HOUSE
description: The House Foreign Affairs Committee, in a rebuff to the Administration, approved today a bill that would repeal sanctions imposed by President Reagan to prohibit the sale of equipment for the proposed Soviet natural gas pipeline to Western Europe.

title: Costa Ricans Seize Nicaraguan Rightists
description: Fifteen leaders of a conservative Nicaraguan opposition party were arrested here Monday night in the latest crackdown on Nicaraguan politicians in exile here, officials said today.

title: Suspect Gives Up
description: A Queens man surrendered to detectives at the 104th Precinct yesterday in connection with the Feb. 4 fatal shooting of the treasurer of the cemetery workers union, the police said.

title: REDM INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Wallace Sued by Ex-Wife
description: Cornelia Wallace, former wife of George C. Wallace, has filed a $7 million lawsuit against the former Governor of Alabama, contending that he interfered with development of a television series based on her life. Filing identical suits Monday in both state and Federal courts because of jurisdictional questions, Mrs. Wallace charged that NBC lost interest in a proposed series on her life after Mr. Wallace told the network that much of her material rightfully belonged to him.

title: SAFETY BOARD ASSERTS THAT AIR FLORIDA PILOT COULD HAVE AVERTED FATAL CRASH
description: Ice and snow on the wings and engine were a major factor in the crash of Air Florida Flight 90 here last Jan. 13, but the pilot could have pulled out of danger by applying full thrust moments after liftoff, investigators said today.

title: MOYNIHAN OPPONENT FILES FOR PRIMARY
description: Melvin Klenetsky announced yesterday that he had filed petitions with 30,000 signatures to force a Democratic primary against Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan, and said Mr. Moynihan would be ''wasting his money'' if he tried to prove the signatures invalid.

title: CROSS & TRECKER NAMES PRESIDENT AND CHAIRMAN
description: The Cross & Trecker Corporation of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., No. 3 in the machine tool industry, yesterday announced the election of Richard T. Lindgren as president and chief executive officer, effective Oct. 1.

title: OWNING A PET CAN HAVE THERAPEUTIC VALUE
description: GIVEN the opportunity, most pet owners will rave about the joys of sharing their homes with an animal, be it a collie or a chameleon. But they may not realize that, beyond pleasure, their nonhuman companions could help to improve their mental and physical health and even extend their lives.

title: Western Electric
description: Western Electric, a subsidiary of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, said it plans to lower output at a manufacturing plant here by the middle of next year and may lay off about 650 of the plant's 1,250 workers. But it said it would seek to place 25 percent to 35 percent of the staff in jobs at other plants. The plant's production of switching system equipment will be transferred to Oklahoma City and Columbus, Ohio.

title: HINES, EDWARD, LUMBER CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $183,000 for the qr and $693,000 for the 6 mos, net losses from discontinued operations of $3,464,000 for the qr and $7,873,000 for the 6 mos and a net loss of $19,792,000 for the qr and 6 mos on the disposal of discontinued operations...C-Including tax credits of $170,000 for the qr and $800,000 for the 6 mos and net losses from discontinued operations of $404,000 for the qr and $1,678,000 for the 6 mos

title: DOUGLAS & LOMASON CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
ARGUELLO-PRYOR SET FOR NOV. 12 AMID FLURRY OF COMPLIMENTS
description: In the same room where Muhammad Ali threw glasses at George Foreman, and Foreman ripped Ali's tuxedo at a dinner three months before their 1974 fight in Zaire, Aaron Pryor and Alexis Arguello yesterday exchanged pleasantries after the announcement that those two champions would meet Nov. 12.

title: MISS PALMER REGAINS TOUCH OF SUCCESS
description: Sandra Palmer held on last Sunday to win the Ladies' Professional Golf Association Boston Five Classic by one shot. It was the 41-year-old Miss Palmer's first victory in 19 months, her second in five years and the 20th of a pro career that began in 1964.

title: AMDISCO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including a gain from discontinued operations of $133,000...C-Including a gain from discontinued operations of $373,000

title: SOUTHWEST GAS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Filene's Opens 3 More Stores
description: Filene's Basement of Boston today enters the New York market by opening three stores on Long Island, in Manhasset, in Huntington adjacent to the Walt Whitman Mall, and in Levittown at the Nassau Mall.

title: SEISCOM DELTA INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including gains on the sale of property of $9,000 for the qr and $1,701,000 for the 9 mos...C-Net income after a loss of $7,000 for the qr and including a gain of $618,000 for the 9 mos from the sale of property

title: TELECONCEPTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
MOLSON COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: The company is listed on the Toronto and Montreal stock exchanges

title: British Woolworth Loss
description: F.W. Woolworth, the British company that is 52.6 percent owned by the F.W. Woolworth Company of New York, said today its loss in the first half of 1982 had more than tripled, to $5.5 million, from $1.6 million a year earlier. Revenues rose 8.4 percent, to $796.3 million, from $734.9 million.

title: Dome Venture With Japanese
description: Dome Petroleum Ltd. has assured Japanese oil companies that it will be able to start oil production from its development project in the Beaufort Sea as early as 1986, the Arctic Petroleum Corporation of Japan said today.

title: HIGHWAYS AND TRANSIT
description: Though the Interstate Highway System was established 26 years ago, its completion date and true final cost still remain elusive. It is time to redirect Federal interstate funding and, more broadly, all transportation funding away from highway construction and toward repair of the existing system and development of mass transit.

title: Texaco and Mobil Get Well Permits
description: Texaco Inc. and the Mobil Corporation were issued permits for two exploratory wells, the Alaska Oil and Gas Conservation Commission announced.

title: JUDGE DEFENDS ROLE IN CASE, CITES REVIEW RESPONSIBILITY
description: Before passing judgment on the proposed antitrust settlement between the American Telephone and Telegraph Company and the Federal Government, Judge Harold H. Greene studied 8,000 pages of comments on the proposal filed by more than 600 individuals and organizations. He read voluminous briefs submitted by the parties. He heard oral arguments by 20 lawyers during a two-day hearing.

title: Key Rates
description: * Maximum rateSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: Publishers Closer to New Role
description: Newspapers around the country will be encouraged to develop their own electronic-information services as a result of a Federal judge's ruling yesterday delaying the American Telephone and Telegraph Company's entry into the field, according to the publishing executive who led the industry's efforts to keep Bell from becoming a competitor.

title: Water Alert in Bahrain
description: The Government urged citizens today to cut water consumption and said the Persian Gulf area might be running out of drinkable water. It said citizens should cut their average daily consumption from 200 gallons a day to about 70 gallons.

title: HERS
Q&A
description: Q. Due to normal cooking, frying and accumulation of dust from the air, the finish on my kitchen cabinets is dull looking and the surface is sticky. I have tried commercial cabinet cleaners but none seem to work. The cabinets are about 10 years old and have an oak finish. How can I get them clean and make them new looking again? - J.J., Newark.

title: TALCUM COMPANY CALLS STUDY ON CANCER LINK INCONCLUSIVE
description: A major talcum powder manufacturer, while criticizing a recent study linking the use of talcum powder by women to ovarian cancer, said it would further investigate any possible relationship between cosmetic-grade talc and the development of disease.

title: ATOM ARMS POLICY COMES UNDER FIRE
description: President Reagan's nuclear arms control policies have come under criticism from a bipartisan group of 21 senators and from six former senior Government officials.

title: HABIB PEACE PLAN APPEARS ON VERGE OF FINAL APPROVAL
description: Philip C. Habib, President Reagan's special envoy, met here twice today with Prime Minister Menachem Begin, then left for Beirut, apparently on the verge of agreement on a plan to end the fighting in the Lebanese capital.

title: JAZZ: GEORGE NICHOLAS QUARTET
description: GEORGE (BIG NICK) NICHOLAS'S stint at Sweet Basil through Saturday commemorates his tenure at the Paradise jazz club in Harlem, where he booked musicians and led the house band in the early 1950's. For this Paradise Club reunion Mr. Nicholas is a hearty host.

title: CALENDAR OF EVENTS: A TOUR OF ARTISTS' HOMES
description: A House and Studio Tour, sponsored by Guild Hall Museum, 158 Main Street (Route 27), East Hampton, L.I.; 516- 324-0806.

title: RED CROSS SAYS IT DESPAIRS OF AN EFFECTIVE CEASE-FIRE
description: The head of the International Committee of the Red Cross in west Beirut said today that an effective ceasefire was urgently required because ''the overall situation of the civilians is deteriorating seriously.''

title: NUCLEAR PHARMACY INC reports earnings for Yr to May 31
description: B-Including tax credits of $75,900 for the latest period and $281,000 for the yr-ago period

title: LIGHTING AIDS FOR THE ELDERLY
description: Some lighting products useful for the elderly include these: The Decora Touch Dimmer 6606 (Leviton Manufacturing Company, $14.50) is a heat-sensitive wall dimmer switch that can accommodate several lamps. It comes in brown, ivory or white in a rectangular or oval shape.

title: LAWYERS' GROUP ALTERS STAND ON BIAS AT CLUBS
description: The American Bar Association's House of Delegates today voted to rescind a proposal it had enacted in January that had called for a ban on discrimination by private business clubs on the basis of race, religion, sex or national origin.

title: FROM 'RAGS' TO $5 MILLION IN LOTTO CASH
description: After the day-to-day grind of running a coffee shop for 21 years, Andrew Tegerides told his wife, Christina, early this year that he felt depressed. He was tired.

title: ACCELERATION CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including an extraordinary credit of $83,000...C-Including an extraordinary credit of $44,000

title: THURSDAY SPORTS
description: Baseball Mets vs. Chicago Cubs, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadows, Queens, 7:35 P.M. The Mets, slowly gaining on Chicago in their fall toward the National League's Eastern Division basement, open a five-game series against a team that in the last week has been playing better than at any other time in recent years. (Television -SportsChannel, 7:30 P.M. Radio - WMCA, 570; WGBB, 1240; 7:30 P.M.) Yankees vs. White Sox, at Chicago. (Television -Channel 11, 8:30 P.M. Radio - WABC, 770; 8:30 P.M.) Empire State Games The first day of competition, by more than 5,700 male and female amateur athletes in more than a dozen summer sports and ice hockey, at Syracuse University. (Television - Channel 21, 9 P.M., taped highlights.)

title: AIR FLORIDA FAULTS JETLINER IN CRASH
description: Air Florida has disputed the conclusion of a Federal investigative board on the cause of the crash of one of its jetliners last January in which 78 people died.

title: Dr. Roland Patterson; Led Baltimore Schools
description: Dr. Roland N. Patterson, the first black superintendent of the city school system, died Monday of cancer. He was 53 years old.

title: KEYSTONE CONSOLIDATED INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including a tax credit of $1,342,000; yr-ago results reflect accounting change

title: WICOR INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
Rockwell Corp.
description: The Rockwell International Corporation's automotive division said its 4,450 salaried employees in North America would be required to take two weeks of their 1983 paid vacation time during the company's current fiscal years, which ends Sept. 30, 1982, to conserve cash. The company said it would close its headquarters here for two weeks beginning Aug. 23, putting 950 salaried employees on paid vacation.

title: SCOPE INC reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including income from discontinued operations of $24,000 for the qr and $17,000 for the 6 mos

title: COSMOS FALL TO BLIZZARD
description: The Cosmos were defeated at home tonight for the first time in more than a year, losing to the Toronto Blizzard, 4-1, before a crowd of 22,138.

RELIANCE FINANCIAL SERVICES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
AN AMENDMENT TO PROTECT FUTURE TAXPAYERS
description: To the Editor:

title: Comark Seeks $12.5 Million
description: Comark, a defunct government securities brokerage based in Newport Beach, Calif., and now undergoing liquidation, has told its 165 limited partners to provide $12.5 million in new capital.

title: Dow Off Another 2.09 Points
description: Extending one of its sharpest declines in recent years, the stock market yesterday continued to retreat on modest trading volume. Analysts attributed the setback to the same set of worries - a slack economy, disappointing corporate profits and fears of huge budget deficits - that have prevailed recently.

title: FEDERAL REALTY INVESTMENT TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including a gain of $656,000 or 34 cents a shr for the qr and 6 mos on the sale of an apartment building

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * American Express Co. has named George F. Thierry vice president, service establishment sales, U.S. division of the Consumer Financial Services Group, responsible for all U.S. sales activities with establishments honoring the American Express card.

title: SUMMIT OILFIELD SERVICES CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-After losses from discontinued operations of $72,862 for the r and $17,765 for the 6 mos

title: QUIET TEXAN IN A.B.A. POST
description: A few years ago Morris Harrell was approached by an anxious client shortly before his case was scheduled to go to trial. ''I want you to give these guys hell, to go after their witnesses, to make them pay for bringing this lawsuit,'' he told him. But Mr. Harrell, a soft-spoken man, wanted no part of his trial tactics.

title: 2 OTHERS SHOW INTEREST IN BUYING CITIES SERVICE
description: The Phillips Petroleum Company and the Union Pacific Corporation have displayed more than a routine interest in discussing the purchase of the Cities Service Company, sources close to all three companies said yesterday.

title: DISILLUSIONMENT SPROUTS IN CHRISTIAN EAST BEIRUT
description: When Israeli troops moved into the predominantly Christian sector of this city nearly two months ago, they were welcomed as liberators. But now expressions of disenchantment are being heard.

title: SILVERIO'S HAMMER AIMED AT OLYMPICS
description: W hen Manny Silverio was a freshman in high school in 1972, he had a job sweeping the gym at North Bergen High School in New Jersey to help his family, which had come to America a few years before from Cuba. They had got out by an airlift with just the clothes they were wearing and no money.

title: MUSIC: 'KING ROGER,'BY SZYMANOWSKI
description: Our operatic stages these days are awash in late-Romantic revivals - Alexander von Zemlinsky, Franz Schreker and even the obscurer works of Richard Strauss. Monday night, the Wolf Trap Farm Park attempted to add to the list with what was billed as the East Coast premiere, in concert form, of Karol Szymanowski's ''King Roger.''

title: FEUDALISM FOR SALE: BRITAIN OFFERS TITLES OF THE PAST
description: For people who feel a craving for a touch of aristocracy, Strutt & Parker, a firm of British real estate agents, has the solution. For prices starting at about $6,000, they will sell anyone the right to call himself -or herself - Lord of the Manor.

title: Dunes Hotel In Merger Talks
description: Dunes Hotel and Casinos Inc. said it was discussing its possible acquisition by an unidentified company. Dunes said the merger would involve the exchange of cash and debt securities for its stock and would be subject to approval by regulatory authorities and Dunes directors and shareholders.

title: BUSINESS MEN'S ASSURANCE CO reports earnings for Qtr to June 30
description: B-Including tax credits of $1,123,000 for the qr and $1,820,000 fora the 6 mos...C-Including tax credits of $1,334,000 for the qr and $2,565,000 for the 6 mos

title: Shift Is Fought on Oil Tax
description: Producers of Prudhoe Bay crude oil say a Congressional proposal seeking repeal of an adjustment under the ''windfall profits'' tax law relating to the tariff on oil shipments is discriminatory because they would be the only producers affected.

title: Senior Bronco Quits
description: Billy Thompson, who played more seasons in a Denver Broncos uniform than anyone else, has decided that 13 seasons are enough. Thompson, who is 35 years old, said that he would pursue a career as a restaurant operator. A third-round draft choice in 1969 from Maryland State, Thompson played in three Pro Bowl games, including last season's, and was on the all-conference team four times.

title: ELDERLY INCREASE DEMANDS ON AGENCY
description: At age 89, she suffered from arthritis and dizzy spells, and her vision was poor. Two cataract operations and surgery for diverticulitis had depleted her savings. Her only income was $244.90 a month in Social Security benefits, but her rent alone was $250. She finally called the city's Department for the Aging for help.

title: NATIONAL CONVENIENCE STORES INC reports earnings for QTr to June 30
description: Yr-ago results reflect a 20 percent stock divd distributed in Oct 1981

title: RETAIL SALES GAINED 1% IN JULY
description: The nation's retail sales rebounded a bit in July, rising by 1 percent after plunging 3.3 percent in the previous month, the Government reported today. However, the July sales pace was still weak and gave little indication of an economic recovery.

title: NEWPORT ELECTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to July 3
'CRONKITE'S UNIVERSE' IS CANCELED
description: TV has canceled ''Walter Cronkite's Universe,'' the awardwinning prime-time science series featuring the former anchor of ''The CBS Evening News'' that has been on the air for the last three summers.

title: Dedicated Boxer
description: Henry Armstrong was the only fighter ever to hold three titles simultaneously, which he did in 1937 and 1938, when he became champion as a featherweight, a welterweight and a lightweight. Later, Armstrong became a Baptist minister and a community leader who ran Boys' Clubs in St. Louis.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''First was seven, because his lucky number is 437. Then 12, for the month he was born.

title: WHEN A TEEN-AGER REDECORATES, RESULTS SAY, 'IT'S MY OWN
description: ROOM By SHEILA MARY EBY
